jsat.clustering

Class EMGaussianMixture

  • java.lang.Object
    • jsat.clustering.ClustererBase
      • jsat.clustering.KClustererBase
        • jsat.clustering.KMeans
          • jsat.clustering.EMGaussianMixture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Clusterer, KClusterer, MultivariateDistribution

    public class EMGaussianMixture
extends KMeans
implements MultivariateDistribution
    An implementation of Gaussian Mixture models that learns the specified number of Gaussians using Expectation Maximization algorithm.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • cluster

        protected double cluster(DataSet dataSet,
             java.util.List<Vec> means,
             int[] assignment,
             boolean exactTotal,
             java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService execServ)
        Description copied from class: KMeans
        This is a helper method where the actual cluster is performed. This is because there are multiple strategies for modifying kmeans, but all of them require this step.
        The distance metric used is trained if needed
        Overrides:
        cluster in class KMeans
        Parameters:
        dataSet - The set of data points to perform clustering on
        means - the initial points to use as the means. Its length is the number of means that will be searched for. These means will be altered, and should contain deep copies of the points they were drawn from.
        assignment - an empty temp space to store the clustering classifications. Should be the same length as the number of data points
        exactTotal - determines how the objective function (return value) will be computed. If true, extra work will be done to compute the exact distance from each data point to its cluster. If false, an upper bound approximation will be used.
        execServ - the source of threads for parallel computation. If null, single threaded execution will occur
        Returns:
        the sum of squares distances from each data point to its closest cluster

      • clusterCompute

        protected double clusterCompute(int K,

      • logPdf

        public double logPdf(double... x)
        Description copied from interface: MultivariateDistribution
        Computes the log of the probability density function. If the probability of the input is zero, the log of zero would be Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY. Instead, -Double.MAX_VALUE is returned.
        Specified by:
        logPdf in interface MultivariateDistribution
        Parameters:
        x - the array for the vector the get the log probability of
        Returns:
        the log of the probability.

        public <V extends Vec> boolean setUsingData(java.util.List<V> dataSet)
        Description copied from interface: MultivariateDistribution
        Sets the parameters of the distribution to attempt to fit the given list of vectors. All vectors are assumed to have the same weight.

        Type Parameters:
        V - the vector type

        Returns:
        true if the distribution was fit to the data, or false if the distribution could not be fit to the data set.
